message.content:
Below is one systematic way to reproduce exactly what is shown in the photo, using only the orientations given in the dictionary (no re‐orienting blocks).  I have broken it into two sub‐structures (“truck” on the left and “house‐arch” on the right), then listed which dictionary blocks are needed and in what order to place them.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

•  Overall there are two separate builds:

A)  Left “Truck”‐like Structure  
   – Layers & Blocks (bottom to top):  
     1.  Bottom layer has one yellow rectangular block spanning the length, with two horizontal orange cylinders (the “wheels”) on its sides.  
     2.  Above that is a single green rectangular block (the “bed”).  
     3.  Then three small cubes form the “cab”: two blue cubes plus one red cube, side‐by‐side.  
     4.  On top of the cab sit two yellow half‐cylinders forming a rounded roof.  

   – Hence the “truck” uses:  
     • 1 × Yellow rectangular plank  
     • 2 × Orange cylinders (lying horizontally for wheels)  
     • 1 × Green rectangular plank  
     • 2 × Blue cubes  
     • 1 × Red cube  
     • 2 × Yellow half‐cylinders  

B)  Right “House‐Arch” Structure  
   – Layers & Blocks (bottom to top):  
     1.  A red arch block on the ground.  
     2.  A green rectangular plank sits horizontally on top of the arch.  
     3.  Above that, two blue cubes stacked vertically form a taller tower.  
     4.  A triangular roof piece (in orange) sits on top.  
     5.  Finally, two upright orange cylinders flank the arch on each side.  

   – Hence the “house‐arch” uses:  
     • 1 × Red arch  
     • 1 × Green rectangular plank  
     • 2 × Blue cubes (stacked)  
     • 1 × Triangular roof (orange)  
     • 2 × Orange cylinders (vertical)  

In total, there are 16 blocks combining both sub‐structures.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Matching shape/color/orientation exactly (no extra rotation):

•  TRUCK BLOCKS  
  – Bottom yellow plank:  index 8 (yellow rectangular block, horizontal)  
  – Two orange wheels:  index 12 (horizontal orange cylinder) used twice  
  – Green bed:  index 6 (green rectangular block, horizontal)  
  – Two blue cubes (the cab’s front):  index 4 (blue cube) used twice  
  – One red cube (the cab’s side):  index 5 (red cube)  
  – Two yellow half‐cylinders (the curved roof):  index 13 used twice  

•  HOUSE‐ARCH BLOCKS  
  – Red arch on the bottom:  index 1 (red arch block, arch opening forward)  
  – Green plank above the arch:  index 6 again (another horizontal green rectangular block)  
  – Two blue cubes stacked:  index 4 (blue cube) used two more times  
  – Triangular roof piece (orange):  index 16  
  – Two upright orange cylinders (the side columns):  index 10 used twice  

In summary, the indices needed (with repeats) are:

• #1  (x1), #4  (x4), #5 (x1), #6  (x2), #8 (x1), #10 (x2), #12 (x2), #13 (x2), #16 (x1).

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Below is one possible order to place the blocks (you may vary it as long as the final result is the same):

{  
  Step1:  Move block with index 8   // Truck’s yellow base plank  
  Step2:  Move block with index 12  // Left orange wheel (horizontal cylinder)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 12  // Right orange wheel (horizontal cylinder)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 6   // Green rectangular block (truck bed)  
  Step5:  Move block with index 4   // Blue cube (cab)  
  Step6:  Move block with index 4   // Second blue cube (cab)  
  Step7:  Move block with index 5   // Red cube (cab side)  
  Step8:  Move block with index 13  // Yellow half‐cylinder (roof half)  
  Step9:  Move block with index 13  // Second half‐cylinder (roof half)  

  Step10: Move block with index 1   // Red arch (house‐arch base)  
  Step11: Move block with index 10  // Left orange column (vertical cylinder)  
  Step12: Move block with index 10  // Right orange column (vertical cylinder)  
  Step13: Move block with index 6   // Green rectangular block on top of arch  
  Step14: Move block with index 4   // First blue cube for tower  
  Step15: Move block with index 4   // Second blue cube for tower  
  Step16: Move block with index 16  // Triangular roof piece on top  
}

Following those steps with the listed blocks in the given orientations will recreate both the “truck” structure and the little “house‐arch” exactly as in the target image.
